list_definition.mean_english: chắc chắn, có thể tin được

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’m sure that I gave him the book
I’m not sure where she lives / what her address is
‘There’s a bus at two o’clock.’ ‘Are you quite sure?’
I thought the idea was good, but now I’m not so sure
I’ll help you – you can be sure of that!

list_definition.definition: unlikely to fail (to do or get something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You’re sure of a good dinner if you stay at that hotel.
a sure way to cure hiccups
a sure aim with a rifle.

list_ex_of_english: To be sure, virtually any work of history or social science invokes some species of causal argument.
There are, to be sure, fewer inscriptions and no very lengthy ones, but that too reflects the relative poverty of public culture.
To be sure, artistic practice itself was not seen to be demeaning or unbecoming of a virtuoso.
It seems quite probable that at least some of these are increasing in frequency, though it is difficult to be sure of this.
To be sure, the eighteenth-century concept of progress should not be reduced to that ideology.
To be sure, meanings, messages and values are often materialized in objects that carry their force more compellingly and unobtrusively than words.
To be sure, the conference tried to clarify things into four strands, each with three sessions of three papers.
I'm sure that many of you have made great adaptations and gained great wisdom.
